fields.title: Long Bright River: A Novel
fields.description: In a part of Philadelphia hit hard by the opioid crisis, estranged sisters Kacey and Mickey lead very different lives. Kacey struggles with addiction, while Mickey is a beat cop. When Kacey disappears around the same time a string of murders takes place, Mickey becomes obsessed with finding the killer – and her sister – before it's too late.

fields.title: Topics of Conversation: A novel
fields.description: We spend so much of our lives in conversation with others, and those conversations create our stories. This debut novel explores that idea, written almost entirely in conversations between women over 20 years of the narrator's life. It sizzles with anger, indignation and wit, highlighting what can emerge when women start talking.

fields.title: Darling Rose Gold
fields.description: When Patty Watts goes to prison for slowly poisoning her daughter Rose Gold, the sheltered 18-year-old has to learn how to navigate the world alone. Upon her release five years later, Patty comes to live with her daughter and expects to fall right back in line as her little girls’ keeper. But Rose Gold has other, darker plans.

fields.title: Recollections of My Nonexistence: A Memoir
fields.description: This powerful memoir reveals how Solnit’s coming-of-age as a journalist and a woman in 1980s San Francisco shaped her as a writer and a feminist. She grapples with sexual harassment, poverty, trauma, and women’s exclusion from the cultural conversation, while discovering punk rock and the LGBTQ+ community as safe havens. Her words have long empowered people who feel voiceless, and her latest book is no exception.

fields.title: A Long Petal of the Sea: A Novel
fields.description: Pregnant widow Roser and Victor Dalmow, the brother of her deceased love, marry in the aftermath of the fascist takeover in 1930s Spain, in order to flee on a ship chartered by the poet Pablo Neruda. Along with the other refugees, they start over in Chile as Europe erupts in war, and find a way to embrace their new life and each other in exile.

fields.title: Writers & Lovers: A Novel
fields.description: Casey is blindsided by grief after her mother’s sudden death, drowning in debt, and barely making it through her days as a waitress and aspiring novelist. As she struggles to finish her novel, she falls in love with two very different men who can offer her very divergent lives. More than just romance hinges on her choice, and you’ll hold your breath as she decides.

fields.title: It's Not All Downhill From Here: A Novel
fields.description: At 68, Loretha Curry has it all: a booming business, a gaggle of dedicated friends, and a husband who still lights her fire. She’s looking forward to her best days yet to come, when a tragic loss shatters her world. This heartwarming, laugh-out-loud story is rich with the healing power of friendship.

fields.title: The Mercies
fields.description: On Christmas Eve 1617, in remote Vardo, Finland, a freak storm wipes out nearly every man in the village. The women who live there must find a way to survive, some in unconventional ways. When witch-hunter Absalom Cornet is sent to the village with his young bride Ursa, she develops a special bond with local woman Maren. With echoes of the Salem Witch Trials, this historical fiction shows how strong women have always fought for survival.

fields.title: Weather: A novel
fields.description: In a story that feels eerily close to home, we meet Lizzie, a librarian working at the same university where she dropped out of graduate school to help her drug-addicted brother. When her former mentor asks Lizzie for help answering emails to her climate apocalypse podcast Hell and High Water, she's thrown into an increasingly unhinged discussion about what climate change means from both sides of the aisle.

fields.title: Dreamland
fields.description: Don't sleep on this beautiful novel that twists and turns like the Cyclone through Coney Island. Socialite Peggy is sent to spend the summer there, and she's not happy about it — that is, until she falls in love with one of the artists on the pier. When bodies start piling up in the summer heat, Peggy has to untangle a web of deceit before she or those she loves end up asleep forever

fields.title: Such a Fun Age
fields.description: Alix Chamberlain is used to getting what she wants, and she runs a business inspiring other women to do the same. But when her babysitter Emira Tucker gets confronted (and filmed) at a grocery store in Alix's neighborhood,  both women have to confront their places in society. This striking exploration of race, class and what it means to be "woke" in today's world will stick with readers long after the last page.

fields.title: Little Gods: A Novel
fields.description: Physicist Su Lan gives birth alone in a Beijing hospital on the night of the Tiananmen Square massacre, setting off a chain of events that draws her daughter Liya back, 17 years later. Her story is interwoven with that of Zhu Wen, the last woman to know her mother in China and Yongzong, Liya's long-lost father. This is a migration story, but it's also one of love, ambition and the invisible threads that bind us.

fields.title: My Dark Vanessa: A Novel
fields.description: At 15, Vanessa Wye was preyed upon by her charismatic English professor Jacob Strane, and was forced out of her boarding school as a result. Now, 17 years later, Strane stands accused of sexual misconduct by a current student. In light of the ensuing investigation, Vanessa has to reckon with what really happened to her, as well as how its affected her life, ever since. This one's a must-read for the #MeToo era.

fields.title: Uncanny Valley: A Memoir
fields.description: Anna Wiener left her job in book publishing in NYC and moved to San Francisco right as a massive culture shift was underway in Silicon Valley, and found herself caught smack in the middle. This memoir details what it was like navigating startup culture at a unique time in history with candor, wit and just enough juicy details to keep readers hooked.

fields.title: Wandering in Strange Lands: A Daughter of the Great Migration Reclaims Her Roots
fields.description: From 1916–1970, millions of black Americans left the rural South for jobs in the Midwest, North and West, leaving their roots behind. In this deeply researched look at her own family history, as well as that of our nation, Jenkins explores what became known as the Great Migration and what it means for the cultural identity of black Americans.

fields.title: Death in Her Hands: A Novel
fields.description: It all starts with a note that reads, "Her name was Magda. Nobody will ever know who killed her. It wasn't me. Here is her dead body." An elderly widow finds it in the woods and her horror and curiosity soon turns into an obsession. But just as her investigation begins to take shape, we begin to doubt our narrator's grip on reality. This is part crime thriller book, part dark comedy and totally delightful.

fields.title: The Book of Longings: A Novel
fields.description: The latest from Sue Monk Kidd introduces us to Ana, a courageous, intelligent woman who marries Jesus long before his public ministry begins. Based on meticulous historical research, this is a humanizing look at Jesus the man, as well as an inspiring story of a strong woman living in a society bent on her silence.

fields.title: The Sun Down Motel
fields.description: In this creepy supernatural thriller, Carly moves to the decrepit town of Fell to find out what happened when her aunt Viv disappeared from her job at the Sun Down Motel in 1982. After Carly starts working there, strange things start happening. It only gets stranger as she uncovers a possible serial killer preying on women in Fell, and it's not long before the mystery becomes very, very real.

fields.title: Glorious Boy
fields.description: As the Japanese close in on invading India, Claire, and Shep must evacuate the Andaman islands with their mute four-year-old boy, Ty. But just before they're due to leave, Ty and Naila, the local girl who helps them communicate with him, disappear. As time runs out, Shep forces Claire onto the ship, staying behind to search for Ty. As the Japanese take the islands, all three undertake a risky odyssey toward reunion.

fields.title: The Moment of Tenderness
fields.description: Following the thread of L'Engle's lonely childhood in New York to her life as a mom in Connecticut, and the current of faith that runs throughout, this new short story collection offers a look into her world. Fans of A Wrinkle In Time will enjoy dipping back into L'Engle's elegant prose and her distillation of normal life into singular beauty.
